plural noun.description: A people of mixed Semitic and Asian descent who invaded Egypt and settled in the Nile delta c.1640 BC. They formed the 15th and 16th dynasties of Egypt and ruled a large part of the country until driven out c.1532 BC.

origin: From Greek Huksōs (interpreted by Manetho as shepherd kings or captive shepherds), from Egyptian heqa khoswe foreign rulers.
